[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/client.rs] [Function: make_call()] [DoS Attack] Can a malicious Rosetta server send an unbounded response body causing memory exhaustion when json() is called at line 148, leading to client crashes and denial of service? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/client.rs] [Function: make_call()] [Request Body Validation] At line 140, is there size limit validation on the serialized request body before sending, or can excessively large requests cause memory exhaustion or server-side DoS? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/client.rs] [Function: sign_transaction()] [Signature Malleability] At lines 845-850, does the signing process prevent signature malleability attacks where an attacker could modify the signature bytes while keeping it valid, potentially causing replay attacks or double-spending? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/client.rs] [Function: sign_transaction()] [Private Key Exposure] Are private keys properly zeroized from memory after signing at line 845, or do they remain in memory where they could be leaked through memory dumps, swap files, or side-channel attacks? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/client.rs] [Function: sign_transaction()] [Signing Message Validation] At line 834, can an attacker manipulate the RawTransaction deserialization to produce a different signing_message than expected, causing users to sign unintended transactions? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/client.rs] [Function: sign_transaction()] [Key Reuse] Does the function prevent signing multiple transactions with the same private key concurrently, which could lead to nonce reuse vulnerabilities or signature correlation attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/client.rs] [Function: sign_transaction()] [Hex Encoding Validation] At line 834, does hex::decode properly validate input, or can malformed hex strings cause panic or incorrect byte interpretation leading to invalid signatures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/client.rs] [Function: sign_transaction()] [Signature Type Enforcement] At line 849, is SignatureType::Ed25519 properly validated on the server side, or can an attacker submit a different signature scheme causing verification failures or security downgrades? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/client.rs] [Function: get_account_address()] [Public Key Conversion] At line 640, does the try_into() conversion properly validate the public key format, or can malformed keys cause panics or derive to incorrect addresses? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/client.rs] [Function: submit_operations()] [Sequence Number Manipulation] At lines 653-669, if sequence_number is None, can an attacker exploit race conditions to submit duplicate transactions with the same auto-generated sequence number, causing double-spending or transaction replay? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/client.rs] [Function: submit_operations()] [Fee Validation Bypass] At lines 676-684, the fee validation uses >= instead of ==, allowing transactions with higher-than-expected gas costs to pass validation, potentially draining user funds through excessive fees.
